III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a
youth's background or appearance or mental state. Yelling,
threats, ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member raises their voice at the youth when speaking with
them and calls them "thief." One of the youths feel unsafe due to
this.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant was interviewed on 10/3/25. Complainant reported
he did not have any additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/3/25.
Youth A reported on 9/27/25, Youth F left a bag of chips
unattended, and Youth C left a Coca-Cola unattended. Youth A
reported they all left the room and when they came back, the
items were gone. Youth A reported Shift Leader (SL) called Youth
F a “crying baby” because he was upset his chips were gone and
she called the rest of the youth “thieves” because the Coca-Cola
was missing. Youth A reported SL is frequently cranky and raises
her voice at them but has never called anyone names before.
Youth A reported he didn’t have any other concerns, but he
doesn’t want SL to come back and yell at them or call them names
because they’re in a tough situation being at the facility and it
makes him feel bad.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/3/25.
Youth B reported on Saturdays they are each given chips and a
Coca-Cola. Youth B reported on 9/27/25, someone took Youth C’s
Coca-Cola. Youth B reported SL became angry and was yelling.
Youth B reported SL called them all thieves and stated she was
going to complete room checks. Youth B reported SL did a Latino
motion with her hand that meant “a promise to God”, and the
motion typically is used when someone is going to do something
bad to someone else. However, Youth B reported SL didn’t say
what she was going to do. Youth B reported SL called Youth F a
“crybaby” because he was crying over his chips being missing.
Youth B reported SL has never called them names before. Youth
2

B reported he felt SL was trying to be strict with them, but he
wasn’t sure if she intended to be mean.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/3/25.
Youth C reported on Saturdays all the youth get a Coca-Cola and
a bag of chips. Youth C reported he was full, so he left the Coca-
Cola on the counter and went outside. Youth C reported when he
came back inside, the Coca-Cola was gone so he told SL. Youth
C reported SL immediately turned off all the electronics and asked
everyone in the living room what happened to his Coca-Cola.
Youth C reported SL called all the youth “thieves and liars” and
then went and checked their rooms. Youth C reported SL told all
the youth she was mad and didn’t want anyone to talk to her.
Youth C reported SL didn’t yell at them but raised her voice
enough so everyone could hear her. Youth C reported they
thought a bag of chips went missing too and SL called Youth F a
“crying baby”.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/3/25.
Youth D reported a Coca-Cola went missing last Saturday and SL
became very angry, which he could tell because she was
shouting. Youth D reported SL called them all “thieves and liars”
and did searches of their rooms. Youth D reported Youth F said
someone took his chips, and SL called Youth F a “crying baby”.
Youth D reported SL has been strict before, but she has never
yelled at them or called them names before.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/3/25.
Youth E reported they were all chilling in the house, and a Coca-
Cola went missing, therefore SL began yelling and called all the
youth “thieves and liars”. Youth E reported all the youth were
offended by what she said. Youth E reported it was very immature
for SL to get angry and lose control when working with children.
Youth E reported he did not hear SL call Youth F a “crybaby” or
“crying baby”.
Youth F was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/3/25.
Youth F reported on Saturday a Coca-Cola supposedly went
missing. However, Youth F reported he didn’t think it went
missing; he thinks someone drank it and forgot. Youth F reported
SL came in and became angry with everyone. Youth F reported
SL told all the youth they were “thieves with no manners”. Youth F
reported he left his chips on the couch and when he asked for his
chips, SL called him a “crying baby” but immediately apologized
afterwards. Youth F reported SL has never gotten angry or called
anyone names previously.
3

Youth G was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/3/25.
Youth G reported he is Youth F & Youth H’s brother. Youth G
reported all the youth were playing outside and SL called them
inside the house. When they entered the house, SL began saying
someone took Youth C’s Coca-Cola and “we shouldn’t have an
environment where we have thieves and liars” but did not
specifically call anyone thieves and liars. Youth G reported after
no one admitted to taking the Coca-Cola, SL searched their rooms
and found many things other youth were hiding in their rooms (i.e.
boxes of cereal and other food), which is not allowed. Youth G
reported SL took these items and other youth were upset the
items were found and taken from them. Youth G reported he didn’t
submit a grievance about the situation because he didn’t feel like
SL did anything inappropriate. Later in the day, Youth F left his
chips on the couch and SL said, “go get your chips because
you’re going to be crying if someone takes them”. Youth G
reported SL never called Youth F a “crybaby” or “crying baby” but
was trying to explain to Youth F he would be upset if someone
took his chips the same way Youth C’s Coca-Cola was taken.
Youth G reported SL apologized to Youth F afterwards. Youth G
reported prior to the Coca-Cola incident this time, there was
another day where Youth B had a Coca-Cola and Youth C took it
and hid it under the couch. Youth G reported Youth C and Youth E
frequently take other people’s belongings.
Youth H was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/3/25.
Youth H reported on Saturday they all received a bag of chips and
a Coca-Cola. Youth H reported they were playing outside, and he
came inside to take a shower. Youth H reported when he got out
of the shower, they were all told Youth C’s Coca-Cola was
missing. Youth H reported he saw Youth A put Coca-Cola into an
empty water bottle, so he thinks Youth A took it and tried to hide it.
SL asked all the youth who took the Coca-Cola, but no one
admitted to anything. Youth H reported Youth A, Youth C and
Youth E are frequently taking things from others, but pretend they
never did anything. Youth H reported one of them previously took
another youth’s Coca-Cola and hid it prior to this situation. Youth
H reported SL again nicely asked all the youth who took the Coca-
Cola, but no one responded. Youth H reported SL explained how
it wasn’t fair for someone to take another person’s Coca-Cola
because it’s only given to each of them as a treat once per week.
Youth H reported SL was being strict and redirecting the youth so
they would listen and respond but was not mean or rude to
anyone. Youth H reported SL tried to help the youth reflect on
what happened by explaining how if someone begin taking little
4

things, sometimes that turns into taking bigger things, and then
you might be considered thieves. Youth H reported SL never
called any of them “thieves or liars” and was only trying to get
them to reflect and teach them what could happen if their
behaviors continued. Youth H reported he didn’t see any issue
with how SL handled things or how strict she was because if she’s
soft all the time, the youth won’t listen to her or follow directions.
Youth H reported Youth F left his bag of chips on the couch and
SL told Youth F he better keep an eye on his chips because if they
get taken, he will cry about it. Youth H reported SL apologized
afterwards, but Youth F wasn’t upset or anything. Youth H
reported SL never called Youth F a “crybaby” or “crying baby” but
was trying to get Youth F to reflect on what could happen and how
he would be upset if it did. Youth H reported he doesn’t want to
defend anyone, but feels the other youth are being unfair in
accusing SL of abusing them or offending them just because they
don’t like her and don’t like how she redirects them or teaches
them. Youth H reported he doesn’t want to see anyone lose their
job for teaching youth the difference between right and wrong.
Youth I was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/3/25.
Youth I reported a Coca-Cola went missing and SL became upset.
Youth I reported SL asked the youth to return the Coca-Cola but
no one responded, so SL began searching rooms and told them
they wouldn’t be able to have Coca-Colas in the future. Youth I
reported SL told all the youth they were thieves and liars, but he
wasn’t sure if she was trying to get them to reflect by saying if they
took things they would be considered thieves and liars, or if she
was being mean. Youth I reported he was in the other room and
didn’t know her intentions. Youth I reported SL saw Youth F left
his bag of chips on the couch and told Youth F if he didn’t keep his
things close, he would be crying if it was taken. Youth I reported
SL seemed upset when talking to Youth F, but she wasn’t mean;
SL was trying to give Youth F advice. Youth I reported SL
apologized to Youth F afterwards.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/3/25.
Director reported they received 14 grievances about SL regarding
this situation, and they suspended SL immediately. Director
reported he met with the youth to ensure they were feeling okay
and get perspective about what happened per the facility’s
grievance policy.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 10/3/25. Staff 1 reported
every Saturday each youth receives a bottle of Coca-Cola and a
bag of chips. Staff 1 reported Youth C left his bottle of Coca-Cola
5

on top of the kitchen counter. Shortly later, Youth C told SL his
Coca-Cola was missing and someone must have taken it. Staff 1
reported SL asked all the youth if they took the Coca-Cola from
the kitchen. Staff 1 reported all the youth were ignoring SL and not
responding even though SL asked them multiple times. Staff 1
reported SL turned off the TV and electronics so the youth could
pay attention to what she was saying. Staff 1 reported when SL
got their attention, she asked all the youth where the Coca-Cola
was and said this shouldn’t be happening inside the house. Staff 1
reported the youth all responded they didn’t take Youth C’s Coca-
Cola. Staff 1 reported SL proceeded to tell them they would stop
being given Coca-Cola on Saturdays if youth were going to steal
them from each other because it’s not fair. Staff 1 reported SL
said, “this behavior is something you shouldn’t do here because
you shouldn’t behave like thieves”. Staff 1 reported SL conducted
room searches since the youth continued to deny anyone took the
Coca-Cola. Staff 1 reported during room searches SL found 7
boxes of cereal and a fishing pole in Youth A’s room. Staff 1
reported since she found objects in Youth A’s room he wasn’t
supposed to have, she continued searching all their rooms. Staff 1
reported she assisted with room searches per SL’s request. Staff
1 reported SL was a little upset about the situation because this
isn’t the first time things have gone missing, and they’ve talked
about not taking each other’s belongings. Staff 1 reported SL was
being strict but wasn’t yelling or being mean to the youth. Staff 1
reported SL did not call the youth “thieves” but simply provided an
example that taking something that doesn’t belong to them is the
behavior of a thief. Staff 1 reported she did not hear SL call any
youth liars. Staff 1 reported she did not hear SL have a
conversation with Youth F about his bag of chips or call him any
names. Staff 1 reported SL could have handled the situation more
positively, however, due to the repeated concern about stealing
other people’s belongings, Staff 1 understands why SL was
frustrated.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 10/17/25. Staff 2 reported
on Saturday Youth A, Youth F, Youth G and Youth H were inside
while the rest of the youth were outside. Staff 2 reported she was
outside with the youth but came inside to use the restroom. Staff 2
reported when she came inside, she saw a Coca-Cola on the
counter. However, when Staff 2, SL and all the youth came inside
she saw the Coca-Cola was no longer there. Staff 2 reported SL
began asking all the youth who took it, and no one took
responsibility or admitted they had it. Staff 2 reported SL said she
would check rooms to find it if no one returned it. Staff 2 reported
no one came forward or returned it, therefore SL began checking
6

rooms. Staff 2 reported the youth became mad because SL found
many food items in their rooms they shouldn’t have, and the youth
didn’t want the food items taken from them. Staff 2 reported Youth
A acted very rude towards SL, as he began slamming stuff
around, and began kicking pillows in the living room. Staff 2
reported SL spoke separately with Youth A and Youth F, but she
wasn’t a part of those conversations and didn’t know what was
said. Staff 2 reported at no point did SL call the youth “thieves or
liars”, but she did explain to all the youth they shouldn’t take things
that don’t belong to them. Staff 2 reported SL was not rude, yelling
or aggressive towards the youth at any point during the
conversation. Staff 2 reported the youth didn’t like being
redirected, but SL did everything appropriately.
Shift Leader (SL) was interviewed via phone on 10/15/25. SL
reported on the evening of 9/27/25, all the youth received Coca-
Colas and bags of chips. Some youth chose to go outside, and a
few youth stayed inside. SL reported she was outside with the
youth and when they all came back inside, Youth C’s Coca-Cola
was not on the kitchen counter where he said he left it. SL
reported Staff 2 had come in to use the restroom and confirmed it
was on the kitchen counter when she came in approximately 10
minutes earlier. SL reported the youth frequently prank each
other, so she said, “guys, whoever took the soda, now is not the
time to play around, please give the soda back”. SL reported
Youth C said it wasn’t right how some youth were always taking
things and then the youth were arguing about prior things that had
gone missing. SL asked them all to turn off the electronics and
stop playing pool so they could have a conversation. SL reported
she explained they all needed to respect each other’s boundaries
and property, and she reiterated the house rules. SL reported she
never called any youth “thieves or liars”, but she did state they
cannot steal or take things from each other or other people
because then people might think they’re thieves. SL admitted she
spoke in a stern voice and expressed disappointment, but she
never raised her voice, yelled, or was mean to any of them. SL
reported she wouldn’t call any of them names, and she even
stopped them from calling each other names and blaming each
other when they were arguing. SL reported about 10 minutes later
she released them back to their activities and encouraged them to
come forward in the future if they didn’t feel comfortable doing so
in that meeting. SL reported after the meeting, Youth A called her
outside to talk, and he wanted to know why they were trying so
hard to find out who took the soda. SL told him it was important to
each of the youth to get a treat, and it was unfair for someone not
to get their treat because someone else took it from them. SL
7

reported Youth A said, “[Youth C] is always a troublemaker so why
do you even care?”. SL reported she explained to Youth C it
doesn’t matter who it was, they all deserve to have their
belongings and not have them stolen. SL reported Youth A was
very upset and said he felt people were playing favorites, so he
was going to write a complaint.
SL reported after that, she saw Youth F left his chips on the couch
and they had recently had a conversation about keeping track of
your belongings so no one would take them. SL reported earlier in
the day someone had taken one of his pieces of candy he left out
and he was really upset, so she told him he better grab his chips,
or he would be upset again if someone took them. SL reported
when she told Youth F that, another youth (she didn’t know who)
mumbled something under their breath to the extent of “yeah, pick
it up before someone snitches and you start crying”. SL reported
she reminded all the youth not to name call because it wasn’t nice
to do so.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Incident Reports dated 9/29/25 noted youth grievance
information:
o Youth A’s grievance stated, “Second shift lead called
us all “rateros (thieves)”.
o Youth B’s grievance stated, “[SL] said we are
thieves. She checked our rooms, and I don’t like
anybody checking our rooms”.
o Youth C’s grievance stated, “On 9/27/25, we were
outside, and I left my coke on the table and when I
came back for my coke, I couldn’t find it anymore so
I told [SL] and she gathered us all and told us that
we were thieves and stealers because of the coke
and I didn’t like that”.
o Youth D’s grievance stated, “[SL] called us thieves
and liars, and she started to yell at us different
things”.
o Youth E’s grievance stated, “[SL] called us thieves
and liars, and she started to yell at us and say many
things.”
• Code of Conduct Policy and Acknowledgment states staff
will not engage in or permit discriminatory treatment or
harassment of anyone – especially children – for any
reason. SL signed this acknowledgment on 5/8/25.
8

• Behavioral Management Policy states youth must never be
subjected to corporal or other punishment, including
humiliation, mental abuse, or punitive interference with
daily functions of living.
• SL had two disciplinary actions in her employee file
unrelated to this investigation.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews conducted
there is not enough information to support SL was derogatory,
discriminating, or humiliating in her language or actions towards
youth. Interviews with Youth G, Youth H, Staff 1 and Staff 2
supported SL may have said the words “thieves”, “liars” or “crying
baby/crybaby”, but only to describe actions or define the word
describing taking items not belonging to them, not admitting
responsibility for doing so, and how someone would be upset if
their item was taken. There is not enough information to support
these words were said in a malicious way, but rather a way to
teach, explain and redirect inappropriate behaviors. It is also
believed there may be some language barriers by way of words or
messages being misinterpreted due to different dialects being
spoken.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
